distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for libidn2 to version 2.2.0 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2019-12290: Fixed an improper round-trip check when converting A-labels to U-labels (bsc#1154884).
- CVE-2019-18224: Fixed a heap-based buffer overflow that was caused by long domain strings (bsc#1154887).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: GNU libidn2 before 2.2.0 fails to perform the roundtrip checks specified in RFC3490 Section 4.2 when converting A-labels to U-labels. This makes it possible in some circumstances for one domain to impersonate another. By creating a malicious domain that matches a target domain except for the inclusion of certain punycoded Unicode characters (that would be discarded when converted first to a Unicode label and then back to an ASCII label), arbitrary domains can be impersonated.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: idn2_to_ascii_4i in lib/lookup.c in GNU libidn2 before 2.1.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow via a long domain string.
